articles.author: Aleesha Khaliq, CNN
articles.title: People with eating disorders have suffered all their lives. Now they're struggling even more
articles.description: As the coronavirus pandemic has reduced services for those suffering from eating disorders and created new challenges amid the national shutdowns, nonprofits serving them report increased requests for help.
articles.content:
(CNN)Cara Lisette has spent more than half her life battling anorexia. Now under the coronavirus lockdown, she says she is also fighting to find the few foods she considers "safe" to eat. 
Lisette, a 29-year-old nurse, says she was originally diagnosed with … [+7338 chars]

articles.title: New Zealanders are so eager to eat burgers after the coronavirus lockdown that police are having to enforce crowd control
articles.description: Police in New Zealand have been required to enforce crowd control measures at a popular fast food outlet after large numbers of people rushed to buy burgers following a relaxing of the country's lockdown measures on Tuesday.

articles.title: California police investigating after viral video shows deputy punching teen
articles.description: A police department and sheriff's office in Northern California are investigating a deputy's use of force after a viral video showed an officer punching a teen lying on the ground while attempting to detain him.
